scenarioDescription:
The HD 136352 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 136352 is a star with 0.81 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 47.89 light years away from the solar system.

HD 136352 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 136352 system


HD 136352 b

HD 136352 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2019-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 136352 b is 4.802 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 136352 b is 2.040 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.11, and a semi-major axis of 0.0934 astronomical units, HD 136352 b could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.


HD 136352 c

HD 136352 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2019-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.17 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 136352 c is 10.812 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 136352 c is 3.280 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 136352 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 136352 d

HD 136352 d was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2019-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.41 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 136352 d is 8.586 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 136352 d is 2.870 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 136352 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 136352, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HD 136352 - System With 3 Exoplanets
